EBM is a fast implementation of the GA 2M algorithm (Lou et al., 2013), developed in C++ and Python. The implementation leverages joblib to facilitate parallelization across multiple cores and machines, thereby optimizing computational efficiency.

The training procedure, selection of pairwise interaction terms, and case studies are detailed in Lou et al. (2012, 2013) and Caruana et al. (2015).

EBMs offer high interpretability due to the ability to visualize and comprehend the contribution of each feature to a prediction through plotting fj. As an additive model, EBM enables modular reasoning about the impact of each feature on predictions.
